UNSUPPORTED: This functionality is unsupported on the current platform
HELP_QUICKSTART_TEXT: You can find the quickstart guide in this editor's folder.
HELP_ABOUT_TEXT:
km2 City Builder
Version $VERSION

Made with Unity $UNITY
See the LICENSE file for licensing details.
PY_MANAGE_ERROR: The local installation of Python was not successful. The city builder will not be able to function until a valid Python installation is provided in the settings.json file.
PY_MANAGE_INSTALL_OK: The local installation of Python was successful.
PY_MANAGE_DEFAULT_NOT_AVAILABLE:
A valid Python installation has not been provided in the settings.json file.
However, Python can be installed in this program's folder, proceed now?
(You can find licensing information in the file "pythonInstaller/licenses.txt". If you choose "No", you will have to provide a valid installation in the settings.json file, make sure to install all the packages listed in the requirements.txt file in the pythonInstaller folder)
PY_MANAGE_DEFAULT_NOT_VALID:
The Python installation found in this program's folder does not meet the requirements. Re-install it?
(You can find licensing information in the file "pythonInstaller/licenses.txt". If you choose "No", you will have to provide a valid installation in the settings.json file, make sure to install all the packages listed in the requirements.txt file in the pythonInstaller folder)
PY_MANAGE_USER_NOT_AVAILABLE:
The path specified in the settings.json file for the Python installation does not contain any Python executable.
Python can be installed in this program's folder, proceed now?
(You can find licensing information in the file "pythonInstaller/licenses.txt". If you choose "No", you will have to provide a valid installation in the settings.json file)
PY_MANAGE_USER_NOT_VALID:
The Python installation provided in the settings.json file does not meet the requirements. (check the requirements.txt file in the pythonInstaller folder)
Python can also be installed in this program's folder, proceed now?
(You can find licensing information in the file "pythonInstaller/licenses.txt". If you choose "No", you will have to install the missing packages by yourself)
PY_MANAGE_DEFAULT_MODULES_NOT_VALID:
The local Python installation is missing one or more of the required packages for the current core.
Install them now? (You can find licensing information in the file "pythonInfo/licenses.txt" inside the folder of the core)
PY_MANAGE_USER_MODULES_NOT_VALID: The Python installation provided in the settings.json is missing one ore more of the required packages for the current core. Install them before using the core. (check the requirements.txt file in the pythonInfo folder of the core)
PY_MANAGE_ERROR_CORE: The installation of the required packages was not successful. Please provide a Python installation that meets the requirements. (check the requirements.txt file in the pythonInfo folder of the core)
PY_MANAGE_INSTALL_CORE_OK: The required packages were installed successfully. Now you can create and load cities using this core.
NO_CORES: There are no cores installed, to create a city you have to install at least one, you can do so by going to Settings->Preferences, then select one of the available cores and click "Install".
CANNOT_MANAGE_CORES: Please close the current city (File->Close City) before managing the cores.
NO_FORMAT_SPECIFIED: No format specified (you may have accidentally selected a folder, try typing the extension too)
NO_CITY_FILE_ERROR: There is no saved city in the specified folder
QUIT_WARNING: Are you really sure you want to quit? Unsaved changes will be lost.
RELOAD_WARNING: Are you sure you want to reload? Unsaved changes will be lost.
CT_ERASE_WARNING: Are you sure you want to erase the terrain?
CB_ERASE_WARNING: Are you sure you want to erase the buildings?
CT_NO_TEXTURE_TOOLTIP: Set to blank to create invisible terrain
PRESET_OVERWRITE_WARNING:
A preset with this name already exists.
Overwrite it?
PRESET_NAME_EMPTY_ERROR: The preset name cannot be empty.
PRESET_SYNC_WARNING: All objects linked to the selected preset will be assigned the current version of the preset. Proceed?
SELECT_VALUE_TO_LOAD_PRESET: Select a value to load a preset
PREF_UNINSTALL_CORE_WARNING: Are you really sure you want to uninstall the selected core?
PREF_UNINSTALL_CORE_ERROR: The selected core is currently in use, close the current city before retrying.
PREF_UNINSTALL_CORE_ERROR_GENERIC: An error occurred, see the log for details.
PREF_CORES_UPDATE_AVAILABLE_TEXT: An update is available for the core $CORE, do you wish to install it?
PREF_CORES_UPDATE_DIRTY_TEXT: An update is available for the core $CORE. However, local changes have been made to the core, please restore it to its original state before installing the update.
PREF_CORES_UPDATE_NOT_AVAILABLE_TEXT: There are no updates available for the core $CORE.
PREF_CORES_UPDATE_DONE_TEXT: The core $CORE has been updated to version $VERSION.
PREF_CORES_UPDATE_ERROR_TEXT: There has been an error during the update of the core $CORE.
PREF_CORES_INSTALL_DONE_TEXT: The selected core has been installed.
PREF_CORES_INSTALL_ERROR_TEXT: There has been an error during the installation of the selected core.
PREF_CORES_PASSWORD_PH: Insert the git password or token
NO_PRESET_SELECTED_ERROR: To delete a preset you must select one first.
CANNOT_DELETE_DEFAULT_PRESET_ERROR: The default preset cannot be deleted.
DELETE_PRESET_WARNING: Are you really sure you want to delete the selected preset?
TP_CANNOT_AUTOCLOSE_ERROR: You can use this function only if the current patch has exactly 1 point and it is on an anchor
BATCH_ERROR_UPDATE: Syntax error in the update expression
BATCH_ERROR_WHERE: Syntax error in the where expression
BATCH_ERROR_RUNTIME: Runtime error, check the console for details
TP_DELETE_BORDER_MESH_WARNING: Are you sure you want to remove the selected border mesh?
BL_CANNOT_AUTOCLOSE_ERROR: You can use this function only if the current line has exactly 1 point and it is between two anchors
BL_NEED_PRESETS_FOR_AUTOCLOSE: To use this function you must add at least a preset in the random presets list
CB_NEED_LINE_PRESET: No building line preset selected. Select one and retry.
CB_NULL_ONLY: Place only on invisible terrain patches
CITY_ROTATION_ANGLES_MISSING: Select a rotation angle from the dropdown to continue
MIGRATION_ERROR_CORE_IS_FOR_NEWER_PROGRA: The core is for a newer version of the city builder, please update it before retrying.
MIGRATION_ERROR_CORE_IS_FOR_OLDER_PROGRA: The core is for an older version of the city builder, it has to be updated to support the current version.
MIGRATION_ERROR_CITY_IS_FOR_NEWER_CORE: The city is for a newer version of the core, please update it before retrying.
MIGRATION_ERROR_WRONG_MIGRATION_NAME: One of the migrations has a wrong name, it has to be fixed before the city can be updated.
MIGRATION_ERROR_MISSING_MIGRATIONS: A migration is missing, it has to be created before the city can be updated.
MIGRATION_NEEDED_TEXT:
The city has been created with an older version of the core or of the city builder, it has to be updated before opening it, please make a backup before proceeding.
Proceed now?
CORE_NOT_FOUND: The core used by this city is not installed.
OBJ_LST_TOOLTIP:
Select an object to highlight it.
Use the up/down arrows to navigate the list.
CT_OUTER_PATCH_TOOLTIP:
These parameters affect the outer terrain patch only (i.e. the patch surrounding the entire city if all roads are interconnected)
Note: concave shapes will produce excess vertices breaking the perimeter, delete them to fix it
CT_OUTER_PATCH_FUSION_DISTANCE_TOOLTIP: External vertices closer than this to the others will be removed
CT_OUTER_PATCH_SEGMENT_LENGTH_TOOLTIP: The outer patch will be split in segments each approximately this long
CT_OUTER_PATCH_THICKNESS_TOOLTIP: The external patch is made of two sets of vertices: the road vertices, and a copy of those vertices extruded along the normal. Those external vertices will be extruded by this value
CT_INT_PT_DIST_TOOLTIP: If greater than zero, the patches will be filled with internal points this distant from each other (the points are determined through Poisson disk sampling)
TEX_SEL_LST_TOOLTIP:
Select a texture in this list to get a preview of it before applying it.
Use the up/down arrows to navigate the list.
MESH_SEL_LST_TOOLTIP:
To instantiate a mesh, select it from this list and click on any point in the world.
Use the up/down arrows to navigate the list.
TRANSF_P_SWITCH_SPACE_TOOLTIP: Switches from local to global space and vice versa
BL_LIST_TOOLTIP: There is a building between each pair of dividing points (the first and last point count as such even if not explicitly set)
BS_FLOOR_LIST_TOOLTIP: These are the upper floors, the first X floors are placed at the bottom, the last Y are placed at the top, the remaining ones are placed at the middle, repeated if necessary (X is the low floors count, Y is the high floors count)
BS_BLOCK_LIST_TOOLTIP: These are the types of blocks used by the floors
BS_F_LIST_TOOLTIP: Each slice is a block repeated a specified number of times, each with a specified width (see the parameters below)
BS_F_GROUND_BLOCK_TOOLTIP: Only used for the ground floor
BS_F_GROUND_HEIGHT_TOOLTIP: If editing the ground floor: set 0 to make sliver-only (using only the top block)
BLDG_FIXACUTE_TOOLTIP: Can break long building lines, disable it if needed.
BL_PRESET_LIST_TOOLTIP: The autogenerated buildings will use presets chosen randomly from this list
PREF_GLOBAL_PATHS_TOOLTIP: Content in these folders will be available in all cities (in addition to content of the current city folder)
PREF_LOCAL_PATHS_TOOLTIP: Content in these folders will be available in the current city only (in addition to content of the current city folder)
OVERLAY_TOOLTIP: Example of usage: select a map to make it appear on the ground (the toggle is in the View menu), and then use it as a guide to place roads
TRANSF_P_SNAPTOGRID_TOOLTIP: If checked, when moving the point while holding the Shift key, the position will be snapped to the grid, if deselected, the Shift key will instead restrict the movement to increments of 1 (basically the same thing, but not aligned to the grid)
PROP_ELEM_RND_TOOLTIP: If unchecked, meshes are chosen sequentially, if checked, randomly.
RD_SW_RD_UV_TOOLTIP: Uses road-style UV coordinates for the sidewalks. Use sparingly, as it may look bad when the sidewalk does not have 4 distinct sides (e.g. when going from a road with sidewalks to another without them)
